intro: Luzula parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered wood rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in a spike-like inflorescence. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream sides. The plant has fibrous roots and is often found in moist, acidic soils. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of ecological studies and horticultural interest.
